metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4437 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Mojo IPC in Google Chrome prior to 108.0.5359.124 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-browser-l10n - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-chromedriver - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14').
